_header: When the prime falleth upon Sunday
_description: Prognostics for the weather in the ensuing months according to the day of the week on which the Prime occurs — fourteen lines in couplets

BLHar2252.First Lines:
When the prime fallythe Uppon sondayin pat mone ye shall have
                    drowght[e]…
BLHar2252.Last Lines:
…when pe prime fallythe on Saterdayye shall have plenty of
                    Rayne
BLHar2252.Note:
Names of days of the week in left margin beside each
                    couplet.
BLHar2252.Editions:
Besserman,  Lawrence, Gail Gilman,   and  Victor Weinblatt.  
             “Three Unpublished Middle English Poems from the Commonplace Book of
                John Colyns (B.M. MS Harley 2252).” 
             Neuphilologische Mitteilungen
         71 (1970): 212-38: 237-8.
